---
title: "Data Munging / QA / QC / Cleaning"
author: "Bryce Mecum"
---

Time slot: 60 minutes

Leaning outcomes:

- Students should use the split-apply-combine methodology (base R and dplyr) (consider pushing this into wrangling session)
- Students should learn what it means to test assumptions about their data (assertr)
- Students should learn how to reshape and restructure their data (tidyr)
